feature.deskripsi: ESD MathPath is an innovative platform designed to help students, teachers, and anyone who wants to learn mathematics in a more interactive way. Through digital maps, you can find various contextual math problems that are directly related to the surrounding environment. Not only that, ESD MathPath also allows users to work on problems, save their progress, and compare learning outcomes in a fun way.

stem.deskripsi: STEM, which was initiated by the United States, is an approach that integrates the four disciplines into problem-based learning methods and everyday contextual events. STEM-based learning methods apply knowledge and skills simultaneously to solve a case. This approach is declared as a 21st-century learning approach in an effort to produce human resources with high-quality cognitive, psychomotor, and affective skills.

intro.title: What is ESD MathPath Portal?
intro.description: is a location-based math learning platform that transforms your surroundings into an interactive classroom. Find contextual math problems, work with a repetitive answer system, and track your progress with an engaging digital map!

step1.title: Register & Login
step1.description: Create a new account or login to ESD MathPath Portal to start learning

step2.title: Open Portal
step2.description: Click the 'Portal' menu to view the interactive map with math problems

step3.title: Choose Problem
step3.description: Find the nearest problem or use filters to find problems that suit your needs

step4.title: Solve Problem
step4.description: Answer the problem and submit! The system will auto-check your answer

map.title: Explore Interactive Map
map.description: Use the map to see all problems around you. Colored pins show problem locations.

list.title: List View
list.description: View list of problems as cards in the sidebar. Each card displays location info and distance.

distance.title: Sorting by Distance
distance.description: Problems are automatically sorted by nearest distance from your current location.

click.title: Click for Details
click.description: Click problem card or pin on map to see preview, then click 'Show Problem' to start.

searchBar.title: Search Bar
searchBar.description: Type location name or keywords to quickly find specific problems.

tags.title: Filter by Tags
tags.description: Select tags like 'Geometry', 'Algebra', or other topics to filter problems by category.

favorites.title: My Favorites
favorites.description: Enable 'Favorites' filter to only display problems you've marked as favorites.

sorting.title: Sorting Options
sorting.description: Sort problems by nearest distance or latest date according to your preference.

cooldown.title: Answer System & Cooldown
cooldown.description: ESD MathPath uses a repetitive answer system with cooldown to encourage effective learning and prevent spam.

unlimited.title: Answer Until Correct
unlimited.description: You can answer repeatedly until the answer is correct. No limit on total attempts!

warning.title: 3x Wrong = Cooldown
warning.description: After 3 consecutive wrong answers, the system will activate a 30-second cooldown.

reset.title: Auto Reset
reset.description: Attempt counter will reset automatically after 30 minutes of inactivity or after cooldown ends.

tips.title: Problem Solving Tips
tips.tip1: Read the problem carefully before answering
tips.tip2: Pay attention to the requested answer format (numbers, text, or combination)
tips.tip3: Use hints if available to help understanding
tips.tip4: If wrong 2x, rethink strategy before 3rd attempt to avoid cooldown

favorite.title: Favorites & Bookmark
favorite.description: Mark your favorite problems by clicking the star icon. Favorited problems can be quickly accessed through the "My Favorites" filter to rework or review anytime.
favorite.info: The favorite feature is very useful for saving problems you want to study more deeply or share with friends!

copy.title: Copy Problem
copy.description: Use the copy button to copy problem text along with location information. Perfect for offline study or sharing problems with classmates.
copy.info: Copied text is already neatly formatted and ready to paste into notes or messaging apps!

q1.question: What should I do if I get a cooldown?
q1.answer: Wait until the cooldown timer finishes (30 seconds). Use this time to read hints, study related material, or try other problems that haven't been cooldown.

q2.question: Can I work on the same problem repeatedly?
q2.answer: After answering correctly, the problem will be marked as "Already Answered" and cannot be answered again. However, you can still view the problem and your answer for review.

q3.question: How does distance calculation work?
q3.answer: The system uses your GPS location to calculate distance to each problem using the Haversine formula. Make sure GPS is active for accurate results!

q4.question: Is there progress tracking?
q4.answer: Yes! The system saves all your correct answers along with timestamps. You can see progress through the "Already Answered" status on each problem card.

about.deskripsi: Dr. Dian Kurniati is a lecturer and researcher in Mathematics Education, focusing on the integration of Education for Sustainable Development (ESD), Ethnomathematics, and STEM approaches in mathematics learning. She actively develops innovative learning models that combine local wisdom and digital technology through various research projects, publications, and both national and international collaborations.
